item.text: Some of the prophets said to Elisha, “Look, the place where we meet with you is too cramped for us.

<st data-num="04994" class="">Let’s</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st>. <st data-num="0376" class="">Each</st> of us will <st data-num="03947" class="">get</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">a</st> <st data-num="06982" class="">log</st> from <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>, and we will <st data-num="06213 08033">build</st> a <st data-num="03427" class="">meeting</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> for ourselves <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.” He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st>.”

<st data-num="0259" class="">One</st> of them <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="02974 04994">Please</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">along with</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>.” He <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “All right, <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st>’ll <st data-num="01980" class="">come</st>.”

So he <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> them. When they <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st> at the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st>, they started <st data-num="01504" class="">cutting down</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">trees</st>.

As <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of them <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="05307" class="">felling</st> a <st data-num="06982" class="">tree</st>, the <st data-num="01270" class="">ax head</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05307" class="">dropped</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>. He <st data-num="06817 0559">shouted</st>, “<st data-num="0162" class="">Oh no</st>,<n id="2" /> my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>! <st data-num="01931" class="">It</st> was <st data-num="07592" class="">borrowed</st>!”

The <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st>, “<st data-num="0575" class="">Where</st> did it <st data-num="05307" class="">drop in</st>?” When he <st data-num="07200" class="">showed</st> him the <st data-num="04725" class="">spot</st>, Elisha<n id="2" /> <st data-num="07094" class="">cut off</st> a <st data-num="06086" class="">branch</st>, <st data-num="07993" class="">threw</st> it in <st data-num="08033" class="">at that spot</st>, and <st data-num="06687" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="01270" class="">ax head</st> <st data-num="06687" class="">float</st>.
He said, “Lift it out.” So he reached out his hand and grabbed it.
Now the king of Syria was at war with Israel. He consulted his advisers, who said, “Invade at such and such a place.”

But the <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> this <st data-num="0559" class="">message</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, “<st data-num="08104" class="">Make sure</st> you <st data-num="08104" class="">don’t</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">pass through</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st> is <st data-num="05181" class="">invading</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.”

So the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> a message <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04725 0834">place</st> the <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st> had <st data-num="0559" class="">pointed out</st>, <st data-num="02094" class="">warning</st> it<n id="1" /> to <st data-num="08104 08033">be on</st> its <st data-num="08104 08033">guard</st>. This happened <st data-num="03808 0259 03808 08147">on several occasions</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01697 02088">This</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="03820 04428">king</st> of <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st> <st data-num="05590" class="">upset</st>.<n id="1" /> So he <st data-num="07121 0413">summoned</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">advisers</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, “<st data-num="04310" class="">One</st> <st data-num="07945" class="">of</st> us <st data-num="03808 05046">must be</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">helping</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.”<n id="3" />

<st data-num="0259" class="">One</st> of his <st data-num="05650" class="">advisers</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="03808" class="">No</st>, my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>, O <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>. The <st data-num="05030" class="">prophet</st> <st data-num="03588 0477">Elisha</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> lives in <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> keeps <st data-num="05046" class="">telling</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> the <st data-num="01697 0834">things</st> you <st data-num="01696" class="">say</st> in your <st data-num="02315 04904">bedroom</st>.”

The king<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">ordered</st>, “<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st>, <st data-num="07200" class="">find out</st> <st data-num="0351" class="">where</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> is, so I can <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> some men to <st data-num="03947" class="">capture</st> him.”<n id="2" /> The king was <st data-num="05046 0559">told</st>, “<st data-num="02009" class="">He</st> is in <st data-num="01886" class="">Dothan</st>.”
So he sent horses and chariots there, along with a good-sized army. They arrived during the night and surrounded the city.

The prophet’s attendant got up early in the morning. When he went outside there was an army surrounding the city, along with horses and chariots. He said to Elisha, “Oh no, my master! What will we do?”

He <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">be afraid</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> our <st data-num="0834 0854">side</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">outnumbers</st> <st data-num="0834 0854">them</st>.”<n id="1" />
Then Elisha prayed, “O Lord, open his eyes so he can see.” The Lord opened the servant’s eyes, and he saw that the hill was full of horses and chariots of fire all around Elisha.
As the army approached him, Elisha prayed to the Lord, “Strike these people with blindness.” The Lord struck them with blindness as Elisha requested.
Then Elisha said to them, “This is not the right road or city. Follow me, and I will lead you to the man you’re looking for.” He led them to Samaria.
When they had entered Samaria, Elisha said, “O Lord, open their eyes, so they can see.” The Lord opened their eyes, and they saw that they were in the middle of Samaria.

When the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> them, he <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> <st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st>, “Should I <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> them <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st>,<n id="1" /> my <st data-num="01" class="">master</st>?”<n id="2" />

He <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “Do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> them <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st>! You did not <st data-num="07617" class="">capture</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">them</st> with your <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> or <st data-num="07198" class="">bow</st>, so what gives <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> the right to <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> them <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st>?<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07760 06440">Give</st> them some <st data-num="03899" class="">food</st> and <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, so they can <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> and <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> and then <st data-num="01980" class="">go back</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> their <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>.”
So he threw a big banquet for them and they ate and drank. Then he sent them back to their master. After that no Syrian raiding parties again invaded the land of Israel.
Later King Ben Hadad of Syria assembled his entire army and attacked and besieged Samaria.
Samaria’s food supply ran out. They laid siege to it so long that a donkey’s head was selling for eighty shekels of silver and a quarter of a kab of dove’s droppings for five shekels of silver.
While the king of Israel was passing by on the city wall, a woman shouted to him, “Help us, my master, O king!”
He replied, “No, let the Lord help you. How can I help you? The threshing floor and winepress are empty.”

Then the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st> her, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What’s</st> your problem?” She <st data-num="0559" class="">answered</st>, “<st data-num="02063" class="">This</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, ‘<st data-num="05414" class="">Hand over</st> your <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>; we’ll <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> him <st data-num="03117" class="">today</st> and then <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> my <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="04279" class="">tomorrow</st>.’

So we <st data-num="01310" class="">boiled</st> my <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> and <st data-num="0398" class="">ate</st> him. Then I <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her the <st data-num="0312" class="">next</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, ‘<st data-num="05414" class="">Hand over</st> your <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> and we’ll <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> him.’ But she <st data-num="02244" class="">hid</st> her <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>!”

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">what</st> the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">said</st>, he <st data-num="07167" class="">tore</st> his <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>. As <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> was <st data-num="05674" class="">passing by</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="02346" class="">wall</st>, the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> could <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> he was <st data-num="05921 01320">wearing</st> <st data-num="02009 08242">sackcloth</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">under</st> his <st data-num="01004" class="">clothes</st>.<n id="1" />
Then he said, “May God judge me severely if Elisha son of Shaphat still has his head by the end of the day!”

Now Elisha was sitting in his house with the community leaders. The king sent a messenger on ahead, but before he arrived, Elisha said to the leaders, “Do you realize this assassin intends to cut off my head? Look, when the messenger arrives, shut the door and lean against it. His master will certainly be right behind him.”
He was still talking to them when the messenger approached and said, “Look, the Lord is responsible for this disaster! Why should I continue to wait for the Lord to help?”
